content:
I'd like to start a conversation about what the default stream name/descriptions should be in a new Zulip organization:
https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/4803

Some thoughts:

  • I like having a "zulip" stream, since it's a convenient place for folks to discuss Zulip and get peer support
  • Some folks have suggested s/announce/announcements/
  • It's hard to name streams without knowing anything about an organization, but I feel like perhaps starting with an "off topic" stream may be helpful for people getting started
Do we have options where people can select what kind of organization they are and based on their choices we can create default streams for them?
we have "corporate" vs. "community", and that's it
And this would be a good sort of thing to have depend on that detail

Yeah for instance if we know what kind of organizations are already using Zulip and maybe come up with default stream "sets" based on type of organization, that would be nice! Every software organization is ultimately going to have a "testing" stream, etc..
I think for now, we should constrain ourselves to what we have today, which is "corporate" vs. "community"
But that's a good thought

Cool! On that note, I think a default "new members" stream might be a good idea, since all corporations and communities have new members (at some point). ;) That's all from me for now. I'll share if I think of any more. :)

@Eeshan Garg makes an interesting point about "new members." We have actually been making "new members" be the landing page for first-time users on this realm, and it seems to have been a successful experiment. We haven't yet made it be a default stream for newly created realms. I have thought of "new members" mostly in a big-realm context, but I suppose it's good for new, small realms as well.
probably only for community realms :)
yeah, that seems reasonable, limiting it to community realms

Maybe rename #new members to #introductions? It's one of the streams that I think will get used outside the app (in instructions, help articles, etc), so it'd be nice for it to not have spaces. It also gives a clear thing to do when you land in the app (which is to introduce yourself).

I feel like #introductions is a little too focused. To me #new members feels slightly more welcoming, like it's a place to hang out when you're still in semi-lurker mode and want to chat without spamming other streams.
yeah, could definitely see that logic as well. (And my second point could be mitigated by the default stream description instructs new users to introduce themselves)
yeah, I like the clear-call-to-action concept, so it would be nice to find some middle ground here..."new members" is a little vague
Perhaps #welcome? #hello?
I like #welcome.
Is there any reason why we kept the default stream settings in organisation settings instead of stream settings?
I think the original motivation was that it's something that only admins change. I think we should consider moving it.

The first step I think is to add a "Include in default streams" checkbox for admins in the streams setting (both in the creation form and in the already-created view). I tihnk there may be an open issue/PR for this, if not we should open one.

I like that solution. I also think it's fine to have two ways to change this for admins.
Created #11646. GitHub didnt show any related issues while creating the issue.
cool! There is a PR for this at #7787; might want to point at that. I think it's mostly complete.

ah, there is an open issue, just very old :). #2284
https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/9-issues/topic/issue.20.232284
would be great to pull that PR over the finish line; looks 95% done
(pinging @Balaji since he created the PR)

I think the main motivation for it being on its own page is that if you have 100s of streams in your organization, just having it on stream settings does not really give you a way to find the list of default streams for a new user.
We should invest in adding a filtering feature to "stream settings", and possible after doing that, we might get rid of the "default streams" page.
